title: Officials in Iran Suspect Sabotage in Wave of Fires and Explosions
summary: For weeks, fires and explosions have been reported almost daily in Iran. Officials are investigating what they think is a coordinated campaign.

title: Republicans Rely on Trump’s Promises to Grease the Path for His Agenda
summary: G.O.P. leaders scrounging for the votes to push through the president’s priorities have increasingly turned to him and his team to win over holdouts with special carve-outs and commitments.

title: E.P.A. Is Said to Draft a Plan to End Its Ability to Fight Climate Change
summary: According to two people familiar with the draft, it would eliminate the bedrock scientific finding that greenhouse-gas emissions threaten human life by dangerously warming the planet.

title: FEMA Urban Search and Rescue Chief Resigns, Citing Agency ‘Chaos’, Colleagues Said
summary: Ken Pagurek had told colleagues the Trump administration was causing ‘chaos’ inside FEMA and creating dangerous delays in disaster response.

title: U.S. and Japan Reach Trade Deal
summary: President Trump said on Tuesday that the trade deal he struck with one of America’s closest allies would impose a 15 percent tariff on Japanese exports.

title: Canada Won’t Accept a Trade Deal With the U.S. at ‘Any Cost’
summary: Prime Minister Mark Carney, after a meeting with Canada’s political leaders, downplayed the chances of success in talks aimed at reaching a trade deal with President Trump.

title: Trump Baselessly Accuses Obama of ‘Treason’ as Questions Swirl About Epstein
summary: President Trump deflected questions about the disgraced financier Jeffrey Epstein by lashing out at his perceived enemies.

title: Johnson Cuts Short House Business to Avoid Vote on Releasing Epstein Files
summary: The Republican speaker truncated the legislative schedule for the week ahead of a summer recess, moving to deny Democrats the chance to force votes on whether to release the Epstein material.

title: Ozzy Osbourne, Black Sabbath Lead Singer Turned Reality TV Star, Dies at 76
summary: As the lead singer of Black Sabbath, he helped invent heavy metal. On “The Osbournes,” he presented a comedic counterpoint to his rock ’n’ roll infamy.

title: Ozzy Osbourne, the Lovable Prince of Darkness
summary: The rocker helped define the sound, look and attitude of metal. But his persistence through addiction, his connection to audience and a late-career reality TV show endeared him to generations.

title: 12 Essential Ozzy Osbourne and Black Sabbath Songs
summary: The frontman, who with Black Sabbath helped pioneer heavy metal in 1970s England, always found new ways to reinvent himself.

title: Showdown in New Jersey Over Top Federal Prosecutor
summary: Alina Habba’s term as interim U.S. attorney was set to expire this week. Federal judges announced a replacement, but Attorney General Pam Bondi quickly intervened.

title: Under Trump, Hospitals Limit Transgender Care for Minors, Even in Blue States
summary: Two prominent medical centers in California recently announced they would stop treatments, citing pressure from the Trump administration.

title: U.S. Olympic Officials Bar Transgender Women From Women’s Competitions
summary: The U.S. Olympic & Paralympic Committee changed its eligibility rules on Monday to comply with President Trump’s executive order, taking the decision away from national governing bodies for each sport.

title: In Trump’s Battle With Murdoch, Fox News Is a Complication
summary: The two are constrained by the thing that has kept them linked for a decade: their shared reliance on Fox News die-hards.

title: Malcolm-Jamal Warner Drowned in Area Known for Rip Currents
summary: New details emerged about the death of the “Cosby Show” actor, who drowned on the Caribbean side of Costa Rica.

title: Rip Current Survival Tips: What to Do if You Get Caught in One
summary: From land, a rip current can appear relatively calm, as a strip of water that extends out between breaking waves. Its appearance can be deceiving.

title: Columbia Expels and Suspends Students Involved in Library Takeover
summary: The occupation of Butler Library in May represented an effort by a pro-Palestinian student protest group to regain momentum on campus.

title: Zelensky Targeted in Wartime Protests in Ukraine for the First Time
summary: The demonstrators were angered by government moves to dismantle anticorruption efforts and quell dissent.

title: D.A. Who Led Etan Patz Case Says Conviction Reversal Came as a Shock
summary: Cyrus Vance prosecuted Pedro Hernandez twice. An appeals court overturned the conviction, ruling that the trial judge should not have let jurors consider an improper confession.

title: What to Know About the $250 Visa Integrity Fee for U.S. Tourists
summary: A newly enacted “visa integrity fee” will apply to millions of foreign visitors, including travelers from Mexico, India, Brazil and China.

title: Trump Is Building a Machine to Disappear People
summary: The president’s use of migrants as bargaining chips will corrode international politics.

title: No, Israel Is Not Committing Genocide in Gaza
summary: The charge isn’t only obscene. It’s also absurd.

title: Microsoft Says Chinese State-Backed Hackers Exploiting Flaws in Attacks
summary: At least two Chinese hacking groups were using security flaws in SharePoint, a popular collaboration software, to breach systems, Microsoft said.

title: Sarah Morlok Cotton, Quadruplet Who Knew Fame and Suffering, Dies at 95
summary: She was the last of four sisters who became a Depression-era sensation, performing onstage. Offstage, they endured abuse and were studied for their schizophrenia.

title: Video Taken by Migrant Shows Overcrowded ICE Holding Cell in Manhattan
summary: Immigrants have complained about unsanitary conditions in the facility at 26 Federal Plaza, including paltry meals and a lack of showers.

title: Federal Prosecutors Close Inquiry Into Co-Founder of Kraken Crypto Exchange
summary: The F.B.I. had raided the home of Jesse Powell in 2023 as part of an investigation into claims that he hacked into the online accounts of a nonprofit.
